page.title: 02St Ouen's Bay: Water Sports
page.content: St Ouen's bay is a mecca for surf- related water sports. The combination of the wide, gently shelving, sandy beach and the uninterrupted passage of the sea from the Atlantic Ocean, can, given the right weather conditions produce long, unbroken waves up to 8ft high. Different sports have become associated with each section of the beach.{Surfing}at The Watersplash and El Tico started in the '60's, {Windsurfing}at Sands and{Surf canoeing &{Hobie cats}at the Braye started in the late 70's. These are very popular with the locals though surfboards can also be hired by visitors. The Watersplash has long been the venue of {British and European Surf {Championships}and in 1985 the{British {Surf Canoe Championships}were held there.
